sen.j: 鉤縄（かぎなわ）とは、忍者が使ったとされる道具。
sen.e: Kaginawa is a tool that is believed to be used by ninja.
Kaginawa is a tool that is believed to have been used by ninja.
sen.cmt: 完了不定詞の方がベターだと思われます。
sen.e: Kaginawa is a tool that is believed to have been used by ninja.

sen.j: 縄の先に鉄鉤のついた道具で、足がかりの無いがけを登る時、橋のない谷を渡る時などに使用する。
sen.e: Kaginawa is a tool which is a grappling iron hook affixed to the tip of a rope and it is used when climbing a cliff without a toehold or crossing a valley without a bridge.
Kaginawa is a tool which is a grappling iron hook affixed to the tip of a rope and it is used when climbing a cliff without a toehold or crossing a valley without a bridge.
Kaginawa is a tool which is a grappling iron hook affixed to the tip of a rope and it is used when climbing a cliff without a toehold or crossing a valley without a bridge.

sen.j: 武器としては似たものに錨型の武器が存在する。
sen.e: In terms of weapon, there exists an anchor-shaped weapon similar to kaginawa.
In terms of weapon, there exists an anchor-shaped weapon similar to kaginawa.
In terms of weapon, there exists an anchor-shaped weapon similar to kaginawa.

sen.j: 同じような形状のものは、捕り物道具（龍太や万力鎖など）や農民の武器（鎖鎌など）などに多い。
sen.e: Similar shape as kaginawa may be mostly found in torimono dogu (tools of arrest) (such as ryuta, manriki-gusari) (manriki-gusari is a traditional Japanese chain weapon with two steel-weights on the ends designed to strike, ensnare or trap an opponent) and peasants' weapons (such as kusarigama) (kusarigama is a traditional Japanese weapon that consists of kama (the Japanese equivalent of a sickle) on a metal chain with a heavy iron weight at the end).

Similar shape as kaginawa may be mostly found in torimono dogu (tools of arrest) (such as ryuta, manriki-gusari) (manriki-gusari is a traditional Japanese chain weapon with two steel-weights on the ends designed to strike, ensnare or trap an opponent) and peasants' weapons (such as kusarigama) (kusarigama is a traditional Japanese weapon that consists of kama (the Japanese equivalent of a sickle) on a metal chain with a heavy iron weight at the end).

Similar shape as kaginawa may be mostly found in torimono dogu (tools of arrest) (such as ryuta, manriki-gusari) (manriki-gusari is a traditional Japanese chain weapon with two steel-weights on the ends designed to strike, ensnare or trap an opponent) and peasants' weapons (such as kusarigama) (kusarigama is a traditional Japanese weapon that consists of kama (the Japanese equivalent of a sickle) on a metal chain with a heavy iron weight at the end).

sen.j: 忍者七つ道具の一つに数えられる。
sen.e: Kaginawa is counted as one of the seven tools for ninja.
Kaginawa is counted as one of the seven tools for ninja.
Kaginawa is counted as one of the seven tools for ninja.
